events.title: As Iran's protests continue, Israelis and Palestinians watch closely
events.summary: There is broad support for the protests among Israeli officials, but Palestinians say they hope the Iranian regime stays in place and the protests die down soon.

events.title: Minnesota sues over Trump's ICE enforcement. And, SCOTUS hears trans athlete cases
events.summary: Minnesota officials sued the Trump administration over unconstitutional ICE conduct. And, SCOTUS hears two cases on whether states can bar transgender athletes from women's sports.

events.title: Trump continues to threaten military action against Iran
events.summary: Amid a deadly crackdown on protesters in Iran, President Trump continues to threaten military action against Tehran and warned countries that do business with Iran that he could impose a tariff.

events.title: Iran expert talks about the Trump administration's strategy with Iran
events.summary: NPR's Steve Inskeep speaks with Iran expert Karim Sadjadpour about the U.S. strategy toward Iran and why he believes Iran's regime could collapse.

events.title: UN International Court of Justice to hear 1st genocide case in over a decade
events.summary: The United Nations International Court of Justice is hearing a genocide case for the first time in more than a decade. The case is focused on the persecution of Rohingya Muslims in Myanmar.

events.title: 'Fly, Wild Swans' is Jung Chang's painfully personal tribute to her mother
events.summary: A historian of modern China, Jung Chang turns the lens back on herself in her newest book to understand how she sees the world and why she writes about China today.

events.title: Markets and restaurants return to Gaza, but few can afford the expensive price tag
events.summary: New eateries are popping up in Gaza after months of famine, but it's pricey and many people still rely on aid to survive.

events.title: People in Iran describe heavy security and some damage in first calls to outside world
events.summary: Iranians made phone calls abroad for the first time in days Tuesday after authorities severed communications during a crackdown on nationwide protests that activists say killed at least 646 people.

events.title: Elon Musk's X faces bans and investigations over nonconsensual bikini images
events.summary: After the social media app's AI chatbot started generating sexualized images of women and children, two countries have blocked it and several more have launched investigations.

events.title: Venezuela begins releasing political prisoners, but hundreds remain behind bars
events.summary: Venezuela has freed a handful of detainees in what it calls a gesture of national unity. Rights groups say releases are slow and the country's repressive system remains in place.

events.title: Uganda: Crackdown, internet blackout ahead of vote
events.summary: Uganda's authorities have shut down rights groups, arrested opponents and their supporters, now they've turned off the internet. After 40 years in office, President Yoweri Museveni has no intention of stepping down now.

events.title: Germany: Gelsenkirchen bank thieves used 'manipulated' door
events.summary: Police say a manipulated emergency exit, that shouldn't open from the outside, gave thieves access in last month's major bank heist in Gelsenkirchen. They warned customers that investigations would likely take months.

events.title: Iran at geopolitical crossroads as protests pressure regime
events.summary: The Islamic Republic is a key player in the Middle East, with close ties to Russia and China. As the regime in Tehran comes under fire, DW looks at Iran's place on the global stage.

events.title: Turkish Cypriots: The EU's invisible Europeans
events.summary: The unresolved Cyprus problem leaves Turkish Cypriots in a state of limbo within the European Union, without full EU rights, recognition or political certainty and economically and diplomatically isolated.

events.title: Japan, South Korea vow stronger ties amid China challenge
events.summary: Japan and South Korea are seeking to strengthen cooperation amid growing geopolitical risks and Tokyo’s worsening relations with Beijing.

events.title: Germany news: 2 men charged with planning attacks for Russia
events.summary: Two Ukrainians have been accused of planning sabotage attacks for Russian spy services. Meanwhile, Germany's foreign minister has played down the US threat to Greenland. DW has more.

events.title: Kazakhstan oil output plunges as Ukrainian drones strike Russia
events.summary: Kyiv's attacks on Russian oil terminals and refineries may damage their enemy, but they are also having an impact on other economies such as Kazakhstan's and risk alienating allies.

events.title: 'We choose Denmark' over the US, Greenland’s PM says
events.summary: Greenlandic Prime Minister Jens-Frederik Nielsen said the Arctic territory was facing a "geopolitical crisis" as Trump threatens to take it over. Denmark's Mette Frederiksen condemned "unacceptable pressure" from the US.

events.title: Will Trump risk a clash with China over Iran tariff?
events.summary: Donald Trump's sudden 25% tariff on nations trading with Iran puts Beijing squarely in the spotlight. China knows how to evade sanctions and has the muscle to retaliate. DW explores what this showdown could mean.

events.title: Iran's communication blackout is 'more serious' than ever before, and this time, the restrictions may become permanent
events.summary: Iran's communication blackout is "more serious" than ever before. Restrictions may last beyond the current protests, according to one expert.

events.title: As Australia burns, locals learn to adapt
events.summary: Another Australian summer, another spate of catastrophic wildfires. As DW's Stuart Braun watched the flames rip through Victoria in recent days, he says the response has been very different to those in the past.

events.title: Australia: Writers' festival called off amid boycott
events.summary: The Adelaide Writers' Week retracted an invitation to an Australian-Palestinian author, citing the the Bondi Beach attack. Dozens, including the event's director and the former PM of New Zealand, withdrew in response.

events.title: France: Le Pen in court to appeal 2027 election ban
events.summary: Marine Le Pen, the far-right heavyweight of French politics is seeking to overturn a court ruling that blocked her presidential bid.

events.title: Trump tells Iranian protesters 'help is on its way'
events.summary: US President Donald Trump called upon demonstrators in Iran to "keep protesting" against state institutions. Trump has previously threatened to intervene in response to the crackdown meted out on protesters. DW has more.

events.title: Will Uganda's election bring change or further hardship?
events.summary: Ahead of Uganda's presidential election, optimists hope for change while others fear chaos, repression, and another term for President Yoweri Museveni.

events.title: Trump to meet with Venezuelan opposition leader Machado
events.summary: After winning the Nobel Peace Prize Trump had wanted and then being sidelined from a post-Maduro Venezuela, Machado is now set to meet with the US president.

events.title: German Chancellor Merz visits India's tech hub Bengaluru
events.summary: Merz is due in Bengaluru, often called India's Silicon Valley, after meeting PM Modi in Ahmedabad. The visit comes just weeks ahead of plans to sign a long-awaited free trade agreement between India and the EU.

events.title: Minnesota sues Trump admin over immigration crackdown
events.summary: The legal action comes after a 37-year-old woman was shot dead by a federal agent in Minneapolis last week. Minnesota Attorney General Keith Ellison says the federal government's actions have "made us less safe."

events.title: Trump announces 25% tariff on Iran's trading partners
events.summary: US President Donald Trump announced a tariff of 25% on goods from countries doing business with Iran. The tariff announcement stands to impact China, Brazil, Turkey and Russia among others.

events.title: Mattel launches first Barbie with autism to promote inclusivity
events.summary: Mattel creates a doll that it hopes represents some of the ways autistic people interact with the world.

events.title: Trump's feud with US Fed chair Powell rattles investors
events.summary: Trump's fight with Federal Reserve Chair Powell just took a new twist — sending stocks and the dollar lower and lifting gold. DW looks into whether a new criminal investigation could put the Fed's independence at risk.

events.title: NATO talks Arctic security for Greenland amid US pressure
events.summary: NATO is signaling it will take steps to bolster Arctic security as the Trump administration has claimed that threats from Russia and China are among the reasons that the US government seeks to take over Greenland.

events.title: Cannabis: Now you can measure how much is too much
events.summary: At what point does smoking weed get dangerous? A British study measured cannabis consumption in THC units and determined which amounts increase health risks. The system comes with clear risk thresholds ― and weaknesses.

events.title: Croatia reintroduces conscription after almost two decades
events.summary: Croatia is bringing back compulsory military service for young men for the first time since 2008. What’s behind the shift — and could it signal a wider return of conscription in the Balkans?

events.title: As industry hiring slows and AI automation grows, EU workers are increasingly wary of switching jobs
events.summary: The pandemic gave workers increased options as home offices became the norm in some fields. Now, with the EU experiencing industrial slowdown and AI automation, workers are growing increasingly wary of switching jobs.

events.title: Cheating scandal hits Winter Olympics skeleton qualifier
events.summary: An international sports governing body is investigating after a Canadian coach was accused of manipulating an event — depriving racers of qualifying points ahead of February's Winter Olympics.

events.title: Why Venus Williams and other sports stars are playing longer
events.summary: More than three decades after she burst onto the tennis scene, Venus Williams is still playing at the top level. Why are we seeing elite athletes carrying on into their 40s and beyond?

events.title: Germany news: Ice warnings force closure of schools
events.summary: Schools in many parts of Germany have closed their doors following warnings of extremely icy conditions. Meanwhile, German Chancellor Friedrich Merz has started his first state visit to India.

events.title: Menopause: When hormones harm the economy
events.summary: There are 9 million women of menopausal age in Germany's labor force. The change of life can have consequences for an economy. There are things that companies can do to retain their workers.

events.title: 2026 World Cup: Germany to be based at North Carolina hotel
events.summary: Germany will be making a hotel in Winston-Salem their base camp during next summer's World Cup. The choice of headquarters has been seen as key to the national team's success — or failure — at previous World Cups.

events.title: From Guatemala to Panama: US affairs in Latin America
events.summary: The US attack on Venezuela is part of a long history of military interventions and political influence by the United States in Latin America. Here are five such examples since World War II.

events.title: Jack London felt 'Call of the Wild,' lived life of adventure
events.summary: The Klondike gold rush, wolves in the Alaskan snow, adventures on the high seas: Jack London, author of "The Call of the Wild" and "The Sea Wolf," was born 150 years ago. DW looks at his life.

events.title: As China sales slow, Germany's carmakers look to India
events.summary: For decades, German cars symbolized engineering perfection and economic power. Now, sales are down as China, a key market, goes electric. India could fill some of that gap for German carmakers. But will it be enough?

events.title: Germany news: Dobrindt vows to fight left-wing extremism
events.summary: The interior minister says he will "hit back" at left-wing extremists suspected of having caused the Berlin blackout.

events.title: Why Germany, India face obstacles to closer strategic ties
events.summary: In the face of US tariffs, Russian threats and China's ambitions, Germany is courting the Asian giant as a trading and geopolitical partner. But it's not so easy.

events.title: German health minister rejects Robert Kennedy's COVID claims
events.summary: US Health Secretary Robert F Kennedy Jr has claimed that doctors in Germany who issued COVID-19 vaccine exemptions are facing legal action. Health Minister Nina Warken has hit back vehemently at the accusations.

events.title: Venezuela, Greenland, Ukraine: Germany's Merz in crisis mode
events.summary: With foreign policy turbulence, a blackout in Berlin and a high-profile personnel rejig in the Chancellery, 2026 is off to a stormy start for Friedrich Merz.

events.title: Berlin blackouts cast light on infrastructure in Germany
events.summary: An attack that knocked out power in a Berlin suburb raises concern about German infrastructure and disaster readiness. What can and should the country be doing?

events.title: Donald Trump's Venezuela attack stuns Europe's far right
events.summary: Right-wing Trump supporters in Central and Southeastern Europe have operated in a legal gray area for years. After the US's attack on Venezuela, there's a growing awareness that Trump could pose a threat to them, too.

events.title: US balks as UK, France pledge troops to postwar Ukraine
events.summary: Even as France and the UK offer a written commitment to Ukraine to deploy troops in the event of a peace deal, doubts remain whether the US will back those troops in case they come under a Russian attack.

events.title: US troops in Germany are legacy of World War II, Cold War
events.summary: Donald Trump's desire to acquire Greenland has raised questions about the US's commitment to NATO. The US maintains a major military presence in Germany — a vital part of its post-World War II national defense strategy.

events.title: Greenland minister rejects US overtures to buy the territory
events.summary: As the United States increases its overtures and threats, Greenland's mining minister told DW that the territory needs to be treated as a partner, and said the people would decide the fate of their island's resources.

events.title: Czechia ruling coalition divided on support for Ukraine
events.summary: Czechia's new coalition government is sending out conflicting messages on Ukraine — ranging from anti-Kyiv tirades to halfhearted support. What's going on?

events.title: Epiphany blackface in Spain highlights racism in Europe
events.summary: People in Spain called attention to racism after a public official wore blackface at an Epiphany celebration. Countries such as the Netherlands have begun moving away from blackface traditions after efforts by activists.

events.title: Germany: Trust in the United States is eroding
events.summary: In the monthly ARD Deutschlandtrend poll, Germans polled expressed little confidence that 2026 will be a peaceful and prosperous year. The reputation of the US is at an all-time low.

events.title: Greenland: Vance warns Europe to take Trump 'seriously'
events.summary: Europe should take Donald Trump "seriously" on the issue of Greenland, warned US Vice President JD Vance, as Trump's advisers met with envoys from Denmark and Greenland.

events.title: Why Germany struggles to fight financial crime
events.summary: Germany lacks thousands of state prosecutors to effectively fight organized crime, the German Association of Judges has warned. But others say the judicial system's problems run much deeper than that.

events.title: The impact of US withdrawal from global climate pacts
events.summary: The US has pledged to pull out of dozens of international organizations and treaties established to advance the protection of the planet. But it doesn't spell the end of environmental action.

events.title: What to watch out for as the Bundesliga resumes play
events.summary: Bayern Munich seem to have another Bundesliga title all but sealed. But could a serious challenger still emerge? And who is in danger of relegation? DW has you covered.

events.title: Mercosur deal: French farmers roll tractors into Paris
events.summary: Scores of tractors were driven into Paris in protest over an EU deal that would create the world's largest free-trade area. Some farmers fear they will be undercut with cheaper goods from South America.

events.title: Berlin mayor criticized for playing tennis during blackout
events.summary: Mayor Kai Wegner is facing pressure over taking a tennis break during the first hours of what turned out to be the longest blackout in the German capital's postwar history.

events.title: Ukraine: 1 million without water, heat after Russian strike
events.summary: Ukraine says overnight Russian strikes targeted energy infrastructure in Dnipropetrovsk and Zaporizhzhia, amid freezing temperatures. Meanwhile, Russia says foreign troops sent to Ukraine would be targets. DW has more.

events.title: Germany news: Snow warnings for Hamburg, 'Elli' storm nears
events.summary: German forecasters are warning of disruptive snow and ice in the north, and across most of the country overnight. Meanwhile, Berlin Mayor Kai Wegner is facing criticism for playing tennis amid power outage. DW has more.

events.title: China squeezes Japan on dual-use exports amid Taiwan spat
events.summary: Japan called new Chinese restrictions on dual-use exports for its military "absolutely unacceptable," while Beijing followed up with additional limits on dichlorosilane, a chemical used to make semiconductors.

events.title: Germany's local governments face financial collapse
events.summary: Many cities and municipalities in Germany are near bankruptcy, and no longer know how they're supposed to fulfill their responsibilities. They are blaming the federal government.

events.title: Former NATO envoy says Trump still committed to Ukraine
events.summary: Kurt Volker said Trump wants a quick end to the war, but the conflict continues because Russia's Putin believes he can still prevail.

events.title: Ski jumping: 'Are they trying to pull a fast one on us?'
events.summary: Domen Prevc has followed in his brother's footsteps by winning the Four Hills Tournament. However, more than the Slovenian's achievement, this year's edition may be remembered for less pleasant reasons.

events.title: Venezuela: Trump's $3 billion oil windfall — why it matters
events.summary: US President Donald Trump has announced an agreement with Venezuela's interim government to transfer millions of barrels of oil to the US. DW explores how the plan could be a blow to China, Russia, Iran and Cuba.

events.title: Ukraine updates: Zelenskyy in Cyprus as EU presidency begins
events.summary: Volodymyr Zelenskyy is in Nicosia, while Ukrainian and US negotiators remain in Paris, looking to iron out more details of Tuesday's "robust" security guarantees agreement. Meanwhile, the fighting continues. DW has more.

events.title: How clean energy could save us trillions
events.summary: As clean energy prices fall, a fast transition to renewable energy is the cheapest option on the table. Experts say it could save us trillions in energy costs alone.

events.title: Germany news: Power back in Berlin after arson attack
events.summary: Berlin officials say power has been restored in the southwest of the city after an act of "sabotage" caused a major blackout. Federal prosecutors are investigating a left-wing extremist group. DW has more.

events.title: Trump weighs military option to take control of Greenland
events.summary: The US president has argued that control of Greenland is a "strategic" necessity. Secretary of State Marco Rubio has tried to downplay Trump's rhetoric, emphasizing the preferred option would be to buy Greenland.

events.title: Greenland welcomes European solidarity amid Trump's threats
events.summary: Greenland's prime minister has thanked European allies for their backing after renewed claims on the island by US President Donald Trump. Jens-Frederik Nielsen urged Washington to engage in "respectful dialogue."

events.title: Cold snap hits Europe, disrupting travel
events.summary: Freezing temperatures and snow are gripping much of the continent, disrupting flights and causing traffic accidents. Canals froze in London, cross country skiers took to Hamburg cycle paths, and snow even fell in Madrid.

events.title: Germany news: Merz issues business SOS in letter to allies
events.summary: Chancellor Merz has told coalition politicians the situation in several key German businesses is "very critical." He said the government must prioritize improving areas like energy and labor costs in 2026. Follow DW.

events.title: Unpacking Czechia's devotion to cash and its currency
events.summary: The new government in Prague wants to change the constitution to anchor the Czech crown as the country's legal tender and guarantee the right to use cash, not just cards. Why has it made this pledge, and will it happen?

events.title: NATO could end if US takes over Greenland — Danish PM
events.summary: Denmark's Mette Frederiksen said "everything would stop" in the event of a US attack on another NATO country. European leaders have backed Frederiksen while saying the US "is an essential partner."

events.title: Swiss NYE fire: Bar had not been inspected for 5 years
events.summary: A fire at the Le Constellation bar in the ski resort town of Crans-Montana killed 40 and injured 116 people on New Year's Eve. Swiss authorities have launched a criminal probe into the bar managers.

events.title: T20 World Cup cricket: Why Bangladesh won't travel to India
events.summary: A month before the tournament begins, Bangladesh have said they will not play T20 World Cup matches in India. The decision comes on the back of political and sporting tensions between the countries.

events.title: Berlin blackout: How dangerous are left‑wing extremists?
events.summary: A left‑wing extremist group has claimed responsibility for an attack on a Berlin power plant. What drives such an attack, and how serious a threat does this radical network pose?

events.title: After Venezuela, can the EU protect Greenland from the US?
events.summary: Donald Trump's claims on Greenland are worrying Europe once again. After the US attack on Venezuela, concerns are growing over how far Washington might go — and if the EU has any real tools to defend Danish territory.

events.title: Venezuela: Germany hesitates to condemn US attack
events.summary: The German government seems to have three things on its mind in regard to US capture of of Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro: be cautious, wait and see and don't upset Donald Trump.

events.title: Can Germany escape its economic slump in 2026?
events.summary: The German economy desperately needs a boost in 2026 after years of downturn. Yet despite massive government spending pledges, optimism is fading among economists.

events.title: What to make of Israel's military plans with Greece, Cyprus
events.summary: Cyprus, Greece and Israel are set to step up joint military exercises and training. Turkey seems more concerned about the two EU members' growing procurement of advanced weapons systems from Israel.

events.title: Germany news: Berlin still shivering amid power outage
events.summary: Authorities say left-wing extremists likely carried out an arson attack that has left many Berliners without power. And alcohol can be purchased more cheaply in Germany than almost anywhere else in the EU. DW has more

events.title: Can developing countries leapfrog fossil fuels?
events.summary: Rich nations built their wealth on coal, oil and gas. Now the world is asking poorer countries like Mozambique to chart a different course.

events.title: Ghanaian artist Ibrahim Mahama at top of the art world
events.summary: Best known for large-scale burlap sack installations, Ibrahim Mahama is helping shift power in the art world to the Global South while redefining art as a collective practice.

events.title: Asylum applications in Germany down by half in 2025
events.summary: The Interior Ministry has attributed the drop in applications to stricter migration policies, but other factors also played a role.

events.title: What's next for Venezuela oil after US ousts Maduro?
events.summary: US President Donald Trump says now that Nicolas Maduro is gone, more US oil companies will enter Venezuela and spend billions revitalizing its oil industry. Several key questions have to be answered.

events.title: Germany: Power back for some Berliners, but others freeze on
events.summary: Thousands of households in Berlin might have to wait several days for power, amid freezing temperatures after an outage caused by possible arson. Mayor Kai Wegner called the attack "terrorism."

events.title: Accordion renews image as Germany's top instrument for 2026
events.summary: The accordion is gaining worldwide popularity. Germany has declared it the instrument of the year for 2026. This versatile music maker is used across various genres, from tango to heavy metal.

events.title: Why plastic bans aren't working and what needs to change
events.summary: Four years after Germany phased out light plastic bags, how has the EU addressed plastic waste? And why do single-use items still pile up in takeaway restaurants, shops and the environment?

events.title: China's BYD overtakes Tesla as world's top EV seller
events.summary: Elon Musk's Tesla has had a tough year and faced intensifying competition from Chinese and European rivals.

events.title: Bulgaria joins eurozone despite opposition
events.summary: Bulgaria became the 21st member of the currency union, bringing the number of people using the single European currency to more than 350 million.

events.title: Anthony Joshua discharged from hospital after Nigeria crash
events.summary: The British heavyweight sustained injuries in a car crash that killed two of his friends.

events.title: What to know about 2026 European Capitals of Culture
events.summary: This year, Oulu, Finland, and Trencin, Slovakia, will become Europe's cultural flagships. Learn more about how Europe's Capitals of Culture program brings lasting change to cities.

events.title: Conscription, pensions and AfD on Germany's 2026 agenda
events.summary: Pensions, migration and conscription will continue to dominate domestic politics in Germany this year. Above all, the focus will be on how the far-right AfD fares in upcoming state elections in the former East Germany.

events.title: Women get drunk faster than men due to biology not tolerance
events.summary: At the same table, with the same drinks, women often get drunk faster than men — and alcohol can affect women's brains differently, making its effects stronger, sometimes more rewarding. But also more addictive.

events.title: A German tip for your New Year's resolutions
events.summary: Starting off the year with ambitious plans to become a better person is a widespread Western tradition. What are the most popular resolutions in Germany? And here's how the German language can help you deal with yours.

events.title: Six ways the 2026 World Cup will be different
events.summary: The United States is set to host the 2026 World Cup, along with Canada and Mexico. DW fills you in on why this tournament will be different than its predecessors.

events.title: Sudan defying war to bring joy at AFCON 2025
events.summary: A brutal civil war has been raging in Sudan since 2023. The national football team is participating in the Africa Cup of Nations in Morocco with more than just sporting success in mind.

events.title: What challenges does the world economy face in 2026?
events.summary: From trade tensions and high debt burdens to fears of an AI stocks bubble, the global economy will face an array of risks that could dampen growth in the new year.

events.title: Taiwan heavily reliant on Russian energy for chip manufacturing
events.summary: The island imports significant qualities of Russian naphtha, a fossil-fuel derivative needed in the high-tech sector. Until recently, it also sourced much of its coal from Russia.

events.title: New Year's Eve: How to make resolutions for 2026
events.summary: Quit smoking, exercise more, eat healthier: Every January 1, we plan to do great things over the next year — only to fail most of the time. Here's how to make sure your New Year's resolutions work out.

events.title: Bulgaria joining eurozone is big deal
events.summary: The southeastern European country is set to ditch its national currency in favor of the euro. But while Bulgaria's economy has improved, mismanagement and corruption remain rampant.

events.title: Aurora lights: The science behind the dazzling nighttime spectacle
events.summary: The northern and southern lights have been treating sky watchers to spectacular shows. But what causes the colors, and why shouldn't you whistle at the aurora?

events.title: AI chatbots are 'alarmingly' biased against dialect speakers
events.summary: Don't speak perfect Oxford English? You may face "shocking" levels of discrimination when using large language models, researchers have found. New customized AI models could be the answer.

events.title: Climate coverage shrinks amid Trump's clean energy misinformation
events.summary: A strong majority of Americans say they're worried about the climate. So why do they hear so little about it in the news?

events.title: French actress and activist Brigitte Bardot dies aged 91
events.summary: The French screen legend appeared in 56 films before ending her career in 1973 and dedicating herself to animal rights activism.

events.title: German company Miele to sell more refurbished appliances
events.summary: The secondhand smartphone market has grown significantly in recent years, but other, bulkier items like washing machines are less frequently refurbished and resold. That could soon be changing.

events.title: Achraf Hakimi and football's growing issue: playing time
events.summary: According to a new FIFPRO report, Morocco and Paris Saint-Germain star Achraf Hakimi is a footballer at his limit, having had a season that lasted nearly a whole year. After an injury, he is now at AFCON with Morocco.

events.title: Germany at the 2026 World Cup: What next?
events.summary: Now that they have qualified and drawn in group E, Germany head into the final part of their 2026 World Cup preparations. Here's what to know.

events.title: Why Germany struggles to go digital
events.summary: Germany still leans on fax machines and paperwork for basic public services. How can a nation of tech pioneers be so slow to adopt digital government?

events.title: Peak oil: Why the world can't break its fossil fuel habit
events.summary: Climate change shifted the oil production debate from scarcity to demand. If countries do not deliver on ambitious green pledges, one expert predicts that production may peak within two years, forcing a chaotic decline.

events.title: Berlin: Archaeological finds illuminate the city's medieval past
events.summary: A brand-new museum showcases the many fascinating medieval artefacts that archaeologists are finding underneath the German capital.

events.title: Munich surfers abandon attempt to restart Eisbach wave
events.summary: City authorities are putting up unnecessary resistance to restoring the world-famous surf spot, the local sports association said.

events.title: Football: Afghan women make statement on international stage
events.summary: Afghanistan's female footballers have been fighting in exile to get back to playing internationally for years. Earlier this year, their moment arrived, but their mission is far from complete.

events.title: Can dogs really sense danger?
events.summary: Research shows what canines really can sense — and how social media and human projection fuel belief in their supernatural abilities.

events.title: The Christmas truce of 1914: When the guns fell silent
events.summary: On Christmas Eve 1914, battling German and British soldiers laid down their arms and sang Christmas carols together — a brief moment of peace in the midst of war.

events.title: 7 mysterious languages that have yet to be deciphered
events.summary: Indus, Rongorongo, Linear A: Some ancient writing systems cannot be deciphered. Can artificial intelligence help crack the codes of the past?

events.title: How Germany's Deutsche Bahn aims to fix chronic delays
events.summary: German trains used to run like clockwork. Today, delays are the rule, not the exception. As public anger is boiling over, what went wrong with a system once envied worldwide, and why are the Swiss getting it right?

events.title: Ryanair faces massive fine in Italy over 'abusive strategy'
events.summary: Italy's competition authority AGCM claims the budget airline blocked payment methods and mass-deleted accounts to manipulate travel agencies and force them into partnerships. Ryanair has pledged to appeal the fine.

events.title: North Korea's Kim Jong Un, daughter open luxury resort
events.summary: Five new hotels were opened in Samjiyon, near the Chinese border, with Kim Jong Un praising the "rising status" of North Korea's people.

events.title: This is how Christmas is celebrated at the Vatican
events.summary: This year, Pope Leo XIV will lead the Christmas celebrations at the Vatican for the first time. But the popular Christmas traditions at the heart of the Roman Catholic Church remain unchanged.

events.title: Why Trump backs Bayer in Roundup weedkiller cancer battle
events.summary: The Trump administration has diverged from the position of former US President Joe Biden, throwing its weight behind German chemical giant Bayer in its courtroom battle over the pesticide Roundup.

events.title: AFCON: A 3,000-kilometer bike ride to catch the opener
events.summary: The Africa Cup of Nations is drawing thousands of fans to Morocco, and one chose an unusual way to get there. Moroccan fan Ismail Skira cycled thousands of kilometers from Paris for the opening match.

events.title: Christmas in the air: Why scents spark emotions and memories
events.summary: The scent of fresh pine and apple cider makes you think of the holidays at grandma's house? You're not alone. Smells are our strongest sensory trigger for memories — both happy and painful.

events.title: AI language models duped by poems
events.summary: A new study has shown that prompts in the form of poems confuse AI models like ChatGPT, Gemini and Claude — to the point where sometimes, security mechanisms don't kick in. Are poets the new hackers?

events.title: How Georgian creatives are fighting for their freedom
events.summary: Artists in Georgia are weary but defiant as they face arbitrary arrests, tough new laws and financial hardship from the country's repressive government.

events.title: 'Avatar': How the Na'vi language was constructed
events.summary: Very few people get to invent a new language that is heard by millions: DW talked to linguist Paul Frommer about how he developed the "Avatar" aliens' language.

events.title: Perfume's multicultural journey: From antiquity to TikTok
events.summary: Though often marketed through a Eurocentric lens, perfume's multilayered history spans Mesopotamia, India, Egypt and Europe, besides being retold on PerfumeTok.

events.title: Labor rights in Europe: Who's working over Christmas?
events.summary: From the number of paid days off to the size of the Christmas bonus, not all European countries are equal for workers over the holidays.

events.title: Not just hocus pocus: when words were used to treat the sick
events.summary: Incantations were not only meant to ward off demons, but also to calm patients. A look into medical history reveals what lies behind the idea of tooth worms and the power of utterances like "hocus pocus."

events.title: 3I/ATLAS: Interstellar comet comes closest to Earth
events.summary: Sometimes "the universe comes to us," writes the European Space Agency. On Friday it came really close, when comet 3l/ATLAS passed by us at a ― relatively ― short distance. What exactly is this interstellar visitor?

events.title: Netflix vs. Paramount takeover battle for Warner Bros.: What's at stake?
events.summary: The multi-billion dollar bidding war to acquire Warner Bros. may soon be over. How are the negotiations connected to Harry Potter, Trump, TikTok — and the future of cinema?

events.title: German business bankruptcies hit decade high amid downturn
events.summary: Business bankruptcies have climbed to an 11-year high, with small firms hardest hit by Germany's anemic growth. Economists warn of job losses but see tentative signs that the insolvency wave may be leveling off.

events.title: Five things to know about AFCON
events.summary: Excellent infrastructure, ambitious teams, young stars and veterans who are far from finished — the 35th edition of AFCON promises plenty.

events.title: Can Santa Claus survive in a melting world?
events.summary: As climate change warms the planet, snowy winters are becoming less certain in Europe. Those looking for classic Christmas traditions are learning to adapt.

events.title: Plane owned by ex-NASCAR driver Greg Biffle crashes in US
events.summary: A small aircraft owned by Greg Biffle crashed and exploded while attempting to land at Statesville Regional Airport in North Carolina. Seven people died in the crash, including the 56-year-old retired NASCAR driver.

events.title: Bayern Munich buy ex-Bundesliga stadium for women's team
events.summary: Bayern Munich are set to purchase a larger stadium for their women's team. The club's CEO described the move as "another milestone" for Bayern's women's program.

events.title: Women's health suffers, bearing the brunt of household labor
events.summary: Even as economic roles shift in romantic partnerships, women still shoulder most of the labor at home. Research suggests this is a burden affecting women's health, leading to emotional fatigue and depression.

events.title: Euro 2029 in Germany about more than profit margins
events.summary: Hosting Euro 2029 is a chance for women's football in Germany to leave a legacy beyond profit and prove investment in women is smart move.

events.title: Cheaper, cleaner energy drives Germany's balcony-solar boom
events.summary: The home-fitted renewable-energy sources are inexpensive and easy to install, and reduce electricity costs. Here's what can be learned from their surging popularity in Germany.

events.title: Merz touts EU-Mercosur deal while France, Italy protest
events.summary: The EU-Latin America trade deal has been in the making for a quarter of a century. Though Germany's chancellor called for its completion, France and Italy said it would be "premature" to sign.

events.title: Wealthy nations curb labor migration as demand surges
events.summary: Even before Donald Trump returned to the White House, anti-immigration politics were reshaping migration flows to high-income countries. Borders have been tightened despite economies facing urgent labor shortages.

events.title: AFCON offers hope after World Cup heartbreak
events.summary: Several established African teams ,like Nigeria, did not qualify for World Cup 2026 despite an expanded format. The Africa Cup of Nations, which begins this weekend, offers a different challenge and a chance to build.

events.title: Under-fire FIFA announces $60 World Cup tickets, for the few
events.summary: The good news? FIFA responded to outrage at the most expensive World Cup ever with discount tickets comparable to the cost of a normal game for "loyal fans." The bad news? It's for a tiny share of the tickets.

events.title: Messi's India tour and rise of the solo athlete sports brand
events.summary: In 2025, many global sports stars went on promotional tours purely to support their individual brands. Lionel Messi's tour of India is a reminder of how sport is changing.

events.title: Gas-loving Trump cedes electric car market to China
events.summary: Donald Trump is pushing gas guzzlers over EVs — in spite of climate and cost concerns. China is now set to race further ahead into an electrified automotive future.

events.title: Medical experts are pushing back on new US vaccine policy
events.summary: US health agencies under Robert F Kennedy Jr. and American medical groups are in conflict over childhood vaccination policy. At the heart of the clash is a long debunked, persistent myth about vaccine safety.

events.title: Marine Le Pen's Appeal: Will trial torpedo far-right leader's presidential hopes?
events.summary: Big stress test for the West’s rules-based order or will French judges take it all in stride.

events.title: Iran: Limited internet returns, but no chat or comments
events.summary: In Iran, limited international internet access is affecting nearly 90 million people and severely limiting information coming out of the country, as authorities imposed one of the most extensive nationwide shutdowns in recent years amid widespread protests.

events.title: 'Little appetite for regime change’: Trump offers 'help' for Iran's protesters, but what can he do?
events.summary: US President Donald Trump told Iranian protesters on Tuesday that “help is on its way” as he weighed options to punish Tehran for its brutal crackdown. As the threat of military action looms, analysts say Trump's inclination for one-off strikes means he is unlikely to push for the regime change craved by many protesters.

events.title: Clintons refuse to testify in Epstein probe as Republicans threaten contempt charges
events.summary: Bill and Hillary Clinton have refused to testify in a Republican-controlled congressional committee's investigation into convicted sex trafficker Jeffrey Epstein, accusing Republican chair James Comer of leading a partisan campaign against them.

events.title: Iran says 'ready for war' as Trump weighs strikes
events.summary:
US ⁠President Donald Trump urged Iranians on Tuesday to keep protesting and said help was on the way, without giving details.
 
The US-based Human Rights Activists News Agency said Tuesday that at least 2,000 people have died in the ongoing protests in Iran and brutal government crackdown.

events.title: 'Cultural, political, social phenomenon': Surge in support for far right in US, UK, France, Italy
events.summary: In a turbulent political landscape marked by disillusionment and shifting loyalties, France stands at a critical juncture. The far-right’s rise is not an isolated French phenomenon but a mirror of broader political trends taking root in the West, driven by what Professor Paul Smith, Head of Modern Languages at the University of Nottingham, calls “the politics of frustration” and the feeling of being “left behind”. As France prepares for a post-Macron future, will the center continue their descent, giving way to the far right and far left?

events.title: Tracking the ships delivering sanctioned Russian LNG to China
events.summary: Since late August 2025, China has taken delivery of at least 24 liquefied natural gas (LNG) shipments from two sanctioned Russian facilities, Arctic LNG 2 and Portovaya. This underscores increased cooperation between China and Russia as the Kremlin seeks to boost LNG exports in order to fund its war in Ukraine.

events.title: US gives terrorist designation to Muslim Brotherhood in Egypt, Lebanon, Jordan
events.summary: The US on Tuesday designated the Egyptian, Lebanese and Jordanian chapters of the Muslim Brotherhood as terrorist organisations, accusing them of "violence and destabilisation".

events.title: Macron brandishing 'threat of dissolution' as budget talks resume, although 'unlikely'
events.summary: Crucial budget talks are resuming in French parliament, as MPs have failed to secure the 2026 budget in time last year. President Emmanuel Macron has brandished the threat of dissolution in case parties can't compromise on the text, but in practice it is unlikely to happen. FRANCE 24's Angela Diffley tells us more about the inflammable political context in which these talks are taking place.

events.title: Trump tells Iranian protesters 'help is on its way' and cancels talks with officials
events.summary: US President Donald Trump said on January 13 he’s cancelled talks with Iranian officials amid a protest crackdown, telling Iranian citizens “help is on its way.” Trump did not offer any details about what the help would entail, but it comes after the Republican president earlier said Iran wants to negotiate with Washington after his threat to strike the Islamic Republic that has killed more than 2,000, according to human right monitors. FRANCE 24's Kethevane Gorjestani tells us more.

events.title: Artist Kathia St Hilaire's deceptively delicate visions of chaos and resistance
events.summary: Her intricately layered artwork uses metal, rubber, canvas and printmaking to create scenes of oppression, trauma and renewal. As she stages her first major exhibition in Paris, Kathia St Hilaire joins us to talk about weaving her Haitian ancestry into her pieces, how Vodun practices inspire her work and why the late Haitian poet Frankétienne is a kindred spirit when it comes to his cyclical vision of a chaotic world.

events.title: Marine Le Pen ‘feels hopeful’ as appeal trial begins
events.summary:
French far-right leader Marine Le Pen is set to return to court on Tuesday to appeal a graft conviction, with her 2027 presidential ambitions hanging in the balance. 
 
Le Pen was banned from standing for office for five years, which effectively disqualified her from running in next year's presidential race.

events.title: Deaths overtake births in France for first time since World War II
events.summary: More people died than were born in France last year for the first time since the end of World War II, official figures released on Tuesday indicated. France has long maintained comparatively high birthrates in the face of a widespread drop in the number of children being born across Europe and beyond.

events.title: Iranian on trial in France in case that could help release of French hostages
events.summary: With the situation tense over in Iran, one of the country's national's is facing justice here in France. Mahdieh Esfandiari, a professional translator, is on trial in Paris, facing accusations of promoting terrorism. Her case is being closely watched in Tehran, where two French nationals have been detained since 2022. With Esfan-diari's trial now underway, the pair's release could be on the horizon, depending on the outcome.

events.title: At least 2,000 protesters killed in Iran, with footage suggesting summary executions
events.summary: The death toll from nationwide protests in Iran spiked January 12 to at least 2,000 people killed, activists say. With the Internet down in Iran, gauging the demonstrations from abroad has grown more difficult. The Associated Press has been unable to independently assess the toll. Iran’s government hasn’t offered overall casualty figures. FRANCE 24's Ershad Alijani, journalist at the Observers' desk, tells us more about their findings.

events.title: Marine Le Pen's appeal trial is 'first act of 2027 presidential election'
events.summary: Marine Le Pen is seeking to overturn a March 2025 ruling that found her guilty of misusing European Parliament funds. She was given a five-year ban from holding elected office, two years of house arrest with an electronic bracelet, a further two-year suspended sentence and a 100,000-euro fine. If Le Pen is ultimately prevented from running in 2027, party leader Jordan Bardella is widely expected to be her successor. His popularity has surged, particularly among younger voters, though some within the party have questioned his leadership.

events.title: Meet the French expats living off the grid
events.summary: Some 3 million French citizens live abroad, scattered across the globe. From the snowy uplands of Quebec to a remote, desert island in Guinea-Bissau or the depths of the Ivorian forests, our France 2 colleagues went to meet some of their French compatriots who have started whole new lives. Thousands of kilometres from French shores, they are living out childhood dreams of closeness to nature and joining new communities and cultures.

events.title: Paris's annual agriculture show will be cow-free for first time ever due to lumpy skin disease
events.summary: Cows will be conspicuously absent from this year's International Agriculture Show in Paris following an outbreak of lumpy skin disease, organisers said Tuesday. Europe's largest agricultural fair usually boasts between 500 to 600 cattle.

events.title: Hearing in Marine Le Pen appeal trial expected summer 2026
events.summary: Marine Le Pen's presidential ambitions hang in the balance as the French far-right leader goes to court to appeal against an embezzlement conviction, which barred her from running for office for five years. She has always maintained her innocence and is appealing along with twelve others of the accused. The ruling with could in the summer of 2026.

events.title: 🔴 Live: Death toll from nationwide protests in Iran spikes to at least 2,000, activists say
Iranian stands trial in France over social media posts ahead of possible prisoner swap
events.summary: The four-day trial of Iranian translator Mahdieh Esfandiari on accusations of promoting "terrorism" via her social media posts opened on Tuesday. The case has been linked to a possible prisoner swap to secure the release of French citizens Cecile Kohler and Jacques Paris, who were imprisoned in Iran on espionage charges their families have denied.

events.title: Ex-Corsican nationalist leader Alain Orsoni shot dead at mother's funeral
events.summary: Former Corsican nationalist leader Alain Orsoni, who also served as the president of soccer club AC Ajaccio, was shot dead in Corsica on January 11 during his mother’s funeral. He was 71. Alain Orsoni was one of the leaders of the Corsican National Liberation Front (FLNC) in the 1980s. He later founded and led the Movement for Self-Determination (MPA). He left Corsica in 1996 during infighting within the nationalist movement and lived for several years in exile before returning to the island.

events.title: Marine Le Pen to switch legal strategy in appeal as case opens in Paris
events.summary: France’s far-right leader Marine Le Pen returned to court Tuesday to appeal an embezzlement conviction, with her 2027 presidential ambitions hanging on the outcome of the case. If she is ultimately prevented from running in 2027, Bardella is widely expected to be her successor. His popularity has surged, particularly among younger voters, though some within the party have questioned his leadership. FRANCE 24's Olivia Bizot tells us more from the Paris courthouse.

events.title: UK launches investigation into Musk's Grok amidst global backlash
events.summary: Grok - the AI chatbot developed my Elon Musk's company - is facing growing international backlash for being misused to generate sexually explicit and nonconsensual images. Malaysia and Indonesia have become the first countries to block Grok over the weekend, while a UK media regulator launched a formal investigation into the platform X on January 11. The scandal is fuelling debate on generative AI tools that can produce realistic images, and the lack of safeguards failing to prevent its abuse.

events.title: Iranian protester faces 'imminent' execution, claims human rights group
events.summary: A 26-year-old protester faces "imminent" execution in Iran after he was arrested in connection with anti-regime demonstrations, a human rights group has said.

events.title: Iranian ambassador summoned over country's response to protests
events.summary: Yvette Cooper has confirmed the government has summoned the Iranian ambassador in a statement to the Commons.

events.title: Verifying protests and deaths in Iran - amid brutal crackdown and internet shutdown
events.summary: Footage posted today on social media shows protesters gathered on the streets of the city of Marvdasht in the southern Iranian Fars province, as a fire burns in the background.

events.title: Four people killed in Gaza after walls collapse on tents during strong winds - health officials
events.summary: Four people have been killed in Gaza after walls collapsed on to tents during strong winds and rainfall, hospital authorities have said.

events.title: Australian author charged over child exploitation material
events.summary: Australian author Craig Silvey has been charged with possessing and distributing child exploitation material.

events.title: Trump to lead largest ever US delegation to Davos
events.summary: President Donald Trump will attend the World Economic Forum in Davos next week as head of the largest ever US delegation to attend the annual meeting, including five cabinet members, and a host of congressional representatives and state governors.

events.title: Russian ship captain in court accused of 'grossly negligent' behaviour over North Sea crash
events.summary: A Russian ship captain has been accused in court of "grossly negligent conduct" after a fatal collision with an oil tanker near the Humber Estuary last year.

events.title: A sculptor, a teenage footballer and a hairdresser: Here are the stories of some of those killed in Iran protests
events.summary: A sculptor, a promising teenage footballer and a hairdresser with tens of thousands of followers on Instagram are among at least 2,000 people killed in two weeks of protests in Iran.

events.title: Airports close and flights disrupted as freezing rain and snow hits Europe
events.summary: Airports were forced to close and flights were disrupted in parts of Europe due to icy weather.

events.title: 'He was shot in the heart... many of his friends are dead': Family's shock over teen's death in Iran
events.summary: In a large warehouse on the outskirts of Tehran, the floor is covered in dozens - or possibly hundreds - of black plastic body bags.

events.title: What to know about the Muslim Brotherhood after the US terrorist designation
events.summary: The Trump administration has designated the Lebanese, Jordanian and Egyptian chapters of the Muslim Brotherhood as terrorist organizations

events.title: Mexico arrests 6 alleged Tren de Aragua gang members
events.summary: Mexican authorities have arrested six alleged members of the Tren de Aragua gang in Mexico City for crimes related to drug trafficking, extortion, and human trafficking

events.title: Puerto Rico announces compulsory visits to assess conditions in housing projects
events.summary: Puerto Rico is announcing compulsory visits to the island’s 328 public housing projects to check on residents and their living conditions

events.title: Hundreds in Venezuela come forward to say their loved ones are 'political prisoners'
events.summary: Edilson Torres was set to be buried in his hometown after dying in a Venezuelan prison

events.title: Russian investigators launch criminal case after nine babies die at Siberian maternity hospital
events.summary: Russian authorities have opened a criminal investigation into a Siberian maternity hospital where nine babies died over the country’s New Year holidays, officials said Tuesday

events.title: Landslide in eastern Congo kills at least 13, leaves over 30 missing
events.summary: A landslide in eastern Congo has killed at least 13 people and left over 30 missing

events.title: Trump set to lead largest-ever US delegation to World Economic Forum in Davos next week

events.title: Trump says the U.S. will 'have' Greenland 'one way or the other'
events.summary: President Donald Trump said again that he would like to make a deal to acquire Greenland. Danish Prime Minister Mette Frederiksen has warned that an American takeover of Greenland would mark the end of NATO.

events.title: What to know about Elon Musk and China with Tesla's massive 'Gigafactory' in Shanghai
events.summary: Billionaire tech executive Elon Musk’s relationship with party leaders in China is in the spotlight as the trade war ramps up. NBC News’ Janis Mackey Frayer reports on what this means for his popularity in the country.

events.title: Video of body bags at one Iranian morgue shows scale of Iran crackdown
events.summary: At a morgue near Iran near the capital Tehran, bodies are piling up as protests rock the Islamic Republic.

events.title: Storms tear through tents in Gaza, exposing Palestinians to the elements
events.summary: As the middle of winter arrives for the enclave's 2 million residents, makeshift shelters are struggling to keep the weather at bay while humanitarian groups say aid remains insufficient.

events.title: Trump announces 25% tariff on countries doing business with Iran amid deadly protest crackdown
events.summary: President Donald Trump said Iran wants to negotiate but warned he may still carry out strikes over its violent crackdown on protests challenging the regime's rule.

events.title: Australian teen charged with making hoax mass shooting calls to U.S. institutions
events.summary: An Australian teenager has been charged over multiple hoax calls he allegedly made falsely claiming that mass shootings were underway at major U.S. educational institutions and retailers

events.title: International pressure builds on X and Musk over Grok deepfakes of women and children
events.summary: The United Kingdom’s online safety regulator announced Monday it was formally investigating X.

events.title: Europe scrambles after Trump says U.S. will take Greenland 'one way or the other'
events.summary: President Donald Trump renewed his threat to seize Greenland "one way or the other" from Denmark, as Europe and NATO scrambled to prioritize Arctic security against China and Russia.

events.title: Trump weighs options on Iran as protest crackdown kills more than 500, activists say
events.summary: President Donald Trump has been weighing a range of options against Iran amid the country’s crackdown on protesters that human rights groups say has killed more than 500 people

events.title: Trump says Venezuela is now 'rich and safe,' but on the ground uncertainty remains
events.summary: This article is by F. Brinley Bruton reporting from Bogotá, Colombia, and a Caracas-based reporter who is not being identified because of safety concerns

events.title: U.S. launches 'large-scale' strikes on ISIS targets across Syria
events.summary: The U.S. has carried out what it called “large-scale strikes” against ISIS in Syria, U.S.

events.title: Violent crackdown in Iran as Trump warns regime 'we'll start shooting' if more protesters are killed
events.summary: Protesters ignored threats of severe punishment from Iran’s leaders and warnings from rights groups about undocumented killings as they poured out onto the streets of cities across the country late Friday

events.title: Frantic diplomacy set up last-minute call between Trump and Colombia's Petro
events.summary: Colombian officials called Republicans in Congress seeking help to prevent a U.S. attack after President Donald Trump issued searing comments about their country’s leader.

events.title: Iran shut off from the world as regime struggles to contain escalating unrest
events.summary: Iran’s supreme leader signaled a hard line Friday against protesters rocking the Islamic Republic, accusing them of acting on behalf of President Donald Trump as authorities struggling to contain the unrest shut the country off from the world.

events.title: U.S. seizes another tanker in campaign to control flow of Venezuelan oil
events.summary: The United States has seized another tanker in its campaign to control the flow of oil to and from Venezuela

events.title: Russia fires advanced new ballistic missile at Ukraine
events.summary: Russia attacked Ukraine overnight with a new hypersonic ballistic missile, only its second use of an advanced weapon it says can travel up to 10 times the speed of sound and is unstoppable by air defenses.

events.title: Venezuela says it is releasing an 'important number' of political prisoners
events.summary: The government said it was a "unilateral gesture" to maintain peace; families of those imprisoned have been calling for their release.

events.title: Trump's exit from global climate treaty leaves U.S. without a voice in negotiations
events.summary: President Trump's executive order put an end to decades of U.S. support for the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change, leaving the country without a voice in global climate talks.
